commentary: On the subject of Pacing Concerns, and how we're reprising previously established narrative patterns, the subversions of those patterns can often be used to clip certain kinds of action, or certain expectations, in order to achieve the desired brevity outcomes. Here is the expected reprisal of John's navel-gazing moment by his mailbox, listening to the wind. We clip that and move along more quickly, not just because it leads to better pacing, but because it also ties into Karkat's unfolding character portrait. He's IMPATIENT. He's AMBITIOUS. And he is not about to put up with MY. BULLSHIT. In fact, he's already proven he won't, by slicing his fake name in half.
